rules.rule: Never use console.log/warn/error in production code. Always use the Winston logger imported from src/logger.js.
This project uses ESM exclusively. Use import/export, not require/module.exports. Use node: prefix for builtins (e.g. node:path, node:fs).
Commit messages must follow conventional commits format: type(scope): description. Types: feat, fix, refactor, test, docs, chore, build.
In TypeScript files, avoid 'any' type without a justification comment explaining why it's necessary.
Always use parameterized queries ($1, $2) with pg. Never interpolate user input into SQL strings.
All database operations and external API calls must have proper error handling with try/catch. Log errors via Winston with context.
Do not hardcode locale strings like 'en-US' in Intl.DateTimeFormat or toLocaleString. Use undefined to respect the user's runtime locale.
